channel.title: A "Join the community" thing
channel.description:
Hey, PHP isn't my best subject, and I'm looking to have something where you can click something lilke.. Here is an image to explain what I mean.
[IMG]http://i27.tinypic.com/2vb7gbn.jpg[/img]
And when they click there they go to a page that will say something like Full Name: E-Mail:
And that's all they fill out. Then on the page that has "Click Here to participate." It'll say how many people have participated.
Get what I am saying?

item.title: A "Join the community" thing

Sorry about the spam… that was my brother trying to be funny -.-
[/quote]
sUre…
I suck at PhP as well, but I knew how to do this, of course not as well scripted, but basic scripted.[/quote]

Who asked you, That is a true fact…

[hr]

@Kolli

Your welcome. If you need more help you can add me on msn or aim, (details in my profile)

item.title: A "Join the community" thing
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Sorry about the spam… that was my brother trying to be funny -.-

Anyways, I wrote you a script just save this as:

index.php

Put this in there:

[code]

Kollidierende <?php $step = $_GET['step']; if ($step=='') { ?>

Click here!!!

<?php } else if($step=='1') { ?> 
Full Name: 
E-Mail:
<?php } else if($step=='2') { $count_my_page = ("users.txt"); $hits = file($count_my_page); $hits[0] ++; $fp = fopen($count_my_page , "w"); fputs($fp , "$hits[0]"); fclose($fp); echo "Thanks for participating.
" . $hits[0] . " Have participated so far!"; } ?> [/code]

Now in the same directory of the php file, make a text document named:

users

Your all done, you can now change and edit this to your liking. I made it fast…

Read full topic
